title: Senior Project Manager
content:
Department: PR and Influence
Location: London (Sea Containers)
Contract type: Fixed-Term (12 months)
Full Time/Part time: Full Time
Reporting into: Client Partner (Operations)
 
About Ogilvy: 
Our vision is to inspire brands and people to impact the world. To create big ideas that make a significant contribution to the planet, society, and the bottom line. We believe in today’s world this is the best way for our clients to achieve sustainable growth. We achieve this by breaking down the barriers that restrict talent and ideas. 
Which is why our teams work fluidly across 5 capabilities: Advertising, Consulting, Experience, PR & Influencer, and Health. This allows us to not only operate but innovate at the intersection of capabilities and talent. We believe impact and magic lies at this intersection. Ogilvy scales this by seamlessly connecting and accessing the deep cultural expertise of 132 offices in 83 countries. 
The result is multifaceted ideas for our clients that drive impact and are born from the intersection of platform x culture x technology. 
We call this Borderless Creativity. 
Ogilvy was ranked the number one UK agency at D&AD and was the only UK agency to win a Glass Lions at Cannes. Ogilvy was also nominated network of the year in Cannes Lions, Campaign, Effie Awards EMEA, London International Awards, The One Show and WARC Rankings. 
In 2022, Ogilvy was the most creatively awarded agency globally – including the most awarded agency at the Clio Awards, DMA Awards, Influencer Marketing Awards, London International Awards and The One Show. 
Ogilvy UK’s PR practice won large agency of the year at the PR Week awards. And our Consulting practice was in the Forbes 2022 list of best management consultancy firms. 
 
The Role:
Due to a major new business win, we are looking for a Senior Project Manager with a strong interest in operations, to manage the new beauty account. 
With a specialist focus in influencer marketing, the new beauty account has been set up to service every element of the client’s influencer marketing business – from paid campaigns to gifting, across all divisions and brands. 
Given the scale and scope of the business, solid skills and experience in project management fundamentals are a must (budgeting, planning, developing statements of work etc.) and managing operational success within an agency environment, including managing forecasting and resourcing. However, we are also after an individual with an appreciation and understanding of social media and influencer marketing, from the creative process, strategy, data through to the production - as well as the people skills to foster a team culture.
 
Key Responsibilities:

Oversee project delivery and operations across a large client team, supporting team with all commercial and resource management 
 Support client teams to analyse and identify better ways of working, ensure processes are being followed and identify operational improvements
 Excellent at managing expectations and resolving project-related issues
 Work in collaboration with Account Leads on creation, and updates to statements of work, staff plans and project budgets
 Proactively identifying and solving issues and mitigating risk
 Working in partnership with the commercial accountant to achieve commercial targets - attend commercial meetings with client teams to ensure revenue forecasts, cap plans and resource needs are accurate
 Support account team and others to share our delivery process with clients and adhere to it
 Preparing and reviewing scopes of work and proposal development for consistency and accuracy
 Take an active role in project delivery and be responsible for delivering projects on time, within budget and to quality
 Monitor project costs and timeframes against budgets and milestones, proactively managing exceptions to ensure delivery to plan and budget
 Work with team to identify project risks and issues, ensuring effective mitigation and risk strategies are implemented
 Monitor budgets and work with the business to avoid overburns - Running weekly burn reports, providing analysis and support with servicing levels 
 Resource Management to plan proactively including resource trackers and capacity plans across departments 
 Provide regular training for the team on operational and finance processes
 Support team with financial administration such as raising POs, vendor creation and job number creation and working with Finance on issues relating to invoices / payments / budgets / vendors

Requirements:

Strong interest in project management and operations management
 Demonstrate a proven experience of managing teams and delivering across a wide range of multi-channels, including influencer marketing
 Requires proven experience of working on a fast-paced account, ideally within the influencer marketing space
 Experience of having adapted a delivery processes around client needs
 Strong organisation skills; responsive to colleagues for overall efficiency and effectiveness
 Ability to build strong relationships with peers, external clients, and suppliers, and can achieve results under challenging circumstances
 Ability to make sound commercial and financial decisions, quickly understand problems, propose solutions, and manage client situations
 Ability to stay calm under pressure and to have a focused and positive approach, and be self-motivated, self-driven and comfortable working independently if required
 Strong client service ethos, with a commitment to quality and the will to constantly drive improvements. Commitment to high standards of excellence and integrity
 Possess good business acumen and sound judgment. Must be able to be collaborative, supportive and adopt a team-based approach. Will be eager to provide insight and receive feedback
 An accomplished communicator who gains the confidence of the business whilst being experienced at operating at all levels.
 Negotiates well, actively listens and makes compelling arguments. Can build strong relationships both with clients, peers, and business counterparts

Practitioner Skills 

 Negotiation skills - achieves the best possible outcome in every negotiation in which you take part. Anticipating, defusing, and resolving conflict between colleagues and clients
 Resource forecasting (across departments) – helps the company forecast resource requirements for the coming months by project
 Expert methodology selection - advanced knowledge and application of the company’s project delivery framework. Knowledge and application of industry best practice
 Knowledge of client methodology – the ability to deliver a project using a client's delivery methodology and reporting standards
 Presentation skills – the ability to contribute to and deliver considered, concise and relevant presentations to colleagues and clients.
 Knowledge of the company’s services offering and interdependencies - sound knowledge of all the company’s service offerings

Managerial Capabilities 

 Stakeholder management - ability to successfully manage multiple suppliers, partners and clients to ensure the best outcome for both client and the company
 Budget and financial management - ability to set, monitor and deliver projects and tasks within agreed financial parameters. Ability to understand, interpret and report on all financial aspects of the role
 Mentoring - supports and encourages team members and colleagues across the wider business to manage their own learning

Leadership Attributes 

 Thinks strategically - evaluates risks
 Inspires creativity and innovation - stimulates team creativity
 Drives results - holds self and others accountable to high performance standards
 Builds teams - proactively addresses performance issues and takes appropriate action
 Exhibits professional excellence - maintains composure under pressure
 Builds relationships - manages the needs of diverse stakeholders
 Communicates effectively - effectively persuades others to support ideas
 Champions change - builds commitment to change

 
How we help you Thrive:

 25 days annual leave + 1 Volunteer Day 
Bupa Healthcare
Enhanced Maternity, Adoption and Shared Parental Leave
We have a Flexible Working Model with core working hours: 10am – 4pm
A 1.5:1 Matching Pension Structure
Wellbeing and Health: Up to £25.00 per month towards physical or online exercise class membership, Unmind membership, LifeWorks tool and annual eye tests and development budgets and Wellbeing incentives and activities throughout the year 
Season Ticket Loan and Cycle to Work Scheme
Life Assurance

Our ambition is to attract the very best diverse talent to Ogilvy, and to be the employer of choice in the UK. We want everyone to feel welcome when they join us, and once they’re here, for them to want to stay with us, grow their career, and to feel they belong with us. 
We are an equal opportunity employer and we’re committed to creating an inclusive, welcoming environment for anyone who wants to work at Ogilvy. We believe that for creativity to flourish, everything about how we work must have diversity at its core. Your race, colour, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, or veteran status have no bearing on our hiring decisions. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know and we will do everything we can to accommodate. 
 At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

At Ogilvy we pride ourselves on being an inclusive and equal opportunities employer. We believe in creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity, equity and inclusion.  We strive to recruit from a diverse range of candidates and create an environment which provides the right conditions for belonging. We welcome all applications regardless of race, colour, religion or belief, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, marital status, , sexual orientation and physical or mental disability etc. (please note this is not an exhaustive list). We are also actively focussed on encouraging greater representation by bringing more under-represented talent into our organisation. This is hugely important to us and Ogilvy has a thriving network of employee communities that exist to help everyone, no matter their background, succeed here.

In order to help us achieve this and hold ourselves accountable for progress and monitor our efforts, we invite you to answer the following questions. You are not required to answer any of them, as they are entirely voluntary. They will also not be viewable to those interviewing you as part of your application or candidate profile. If you choose to answer, please know that all data is stored separately, used in aggregate for reporting purposes and handled as per GDPR regulations.
